title: Mindfulness Resources: Loyola University Chicago
description: Loyola University Chicago's Wellness Center offers students both on and off-campus resources for mindfulness.
cleaned_text: Mindfulness Resources On Campus Resources Group Counseling: The Wellness Center has been offering mindfulness sessions to students since 2002. Led by a certified instructor, these groups provide support for new and long-term practitioners. [Check out the list on our groups' page.](/wellness/mentalhealth/groupcounseling/) Places to meditate on campus: Student recommended! Information Commons, the stacks in Cudahy library, chapel in Mundelein, Madonna della Strada Chapel, benches on lakefront. [Taize Prayer Service](http://www.luc.edu/campusministry/sacramental_life/eucharist/ ): Taize Prayer is a liturgy filled with song, scripture, and silent meditation. The sanctuary is candlelit, making a space that is ready for meditative silence and song. At Madonna della Strada Chapel [Yoga classes at Halas](http://www.luc.edu/campusrec/fitness/groupfitness/ )- Classes offered throughout the year Mindfulness Websites: [Greater Good](http://www.greatergood.berkeley.edu): The Science of a Meaningful Life- Based at UC Berkeley, Greater Good reports on groundbreaking research into the roots of compassion, happiness, and altruism. [Mindful Self-Compassion:](http://self-compassion.org/category/exercises/#guided-meditations) Kristi Neff: Definition, the science and practices. [Mindful Self-Compassion](https://chrisgermer.com/meditations/) with Chris Germer: Practices [Ignatian Spirituality and the Daily Examen](http://www.ignatianspirituality.com/)- A basic presentation of the "Daily Examen", an essential tool in Ignatian Spirituality in providing a helpful meditative technique. [Greater Good in Action Web App](http://ggia.berkeley.edu/): Free evidence-based practices to promote greater well-being through exercises like Mindfulness Meditation, Cultivating Gratitude, Deep breathing exercises, and more! On-Line Practices: [Brown Center for Mindfulness](https://mindfulnessandhealthinstitute.org/courses/community-mindfulness-sessions/): Live online community mindfulness sessions [UC San Diego Center for Mindfulness and UC San Diego Sanford Institute for Empathy and Compassion](https://cih.ucsd.edu/mindfulness/free-sessions): Live online community mindfulness sessions [Yoga with Adriene](https://yogawithadriene.com/): Mission - connect as many people as possible through high-quality free yoga videos. We welcome all levels, all bodies, all genders, and all souls. [University of California San Diego Center for Mindfulness](https://cih.ucsd.edu/mindfulness/guided-audio-video): Guided mindfulness and yoga practices Research on Mindfulness [American Mindfulness Research Association](https://goamra.org/): website and organization dedicated to dissemination of empirical research; excellent for finding new study results and new applications [MindRxiv](https://mindrxiv.org/): Open archive for research on mind and contemplative practices Mindfulness Apps Insight Timer (free) Stop, Think Breathe (free) [Headspace](https://work.headspace.com/luc/member-enroll) (Free for the first 2500 students who sign-up. Cost associated otherwise) UCLA Mindful (free) Healthy Minds Innovations (free) [Mindfulness Coach](https://mobile.va.gov/app/mindfulness-coach) (free) Developed by the US Dept. of Veterans Affairs but not just for veterans
